conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval.
The graph shows the vertical velocity v of the skydiver in meters per second (m/s) over time t in seconds.
At t = 0 seconds, the velocity is v = 20 m/s.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is v = 10 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is v = 0 m/s.
The distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval can be calculated using the integral of velocity over time.
Calculate the integral: Distance = ∫ from 10 to 15 of 10 dt = 10 × (15 - 10) = 10 × 5 = 50 meters.
Compare the calculated distance of 50 meters with the given condition of greater than 75 meters.
Since 50 meters is less than 75 meters, the distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 meters.
